meanings.definition: An organization of persons with related interests, goals, etc., especially one formed for mutual aid or protection.
meanings.sent1: The guilds in the town worked together to help each other during hard times.
meanings.sent2: The guilds of artists and writers collaborated on a project to support local talent.
meanings.sent3: The guilds decided to have a picnic to discuss serious matters, which made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, the guilds were like a shield protecting their members from harm.
meanings.sent5: The guilds were like a family, always ready to lend a hand when needed.

meanings.definition: A group of merchants or craftspeople with similar interests or goals.
meanings.sent1: The guilds of carpenters and blacksmiths joined forces to negotiate better prices for materials.
meanings.sent2: In the market, the guilds of traders and vendors set up colorful stalls to attract customers.
meanings.sent3: The guilds organized a friendly competition to see who could create the most unique product.
meanings.sent4: The guilds were like busy bees, each member contributing their skills to the collective hive.
meanings.sent5: Walking through the town, you could hear the sounds of the guilds working diligently in their workshops.
